stream_context.summary: Kaze prototypes a new "soap bar" rideable object and associated bubble effects, experiments with an oil-slick cleaning mechanic, and iterates on a space-saving star-select UI while chatting about tooling, compression, and community events.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a rideable “soap bar” by re-using the Koopa-shell action state and a newly discovered internal "Ridden OBJ" pointer.
development_findings.quote: There's a whole interaction type for this? How did I not know that?

development_findings.summary: Added shrinking logic and custom bubble particle trail for the soap bar, using a bespoke particle engine to avoid repeated texture uploads.
development_findings.quote: The original particle system is really bad because it reloads the texture every time, so I wrote my own.

development_findings.summary: Designed a new star-select screen that shows tiny 3D panoramas instead of full images, avoiding ~0.3-0.5 MB per course and looking sharper on emulator.
development_findings.quote: If we have a pre-rendered 3D scene, it's going to be cheaper ROM-wise and it's going to look better on emulator.

development_findings.summary: Removed the original Mario Kart 64 grass backgrounds, instantly saving about 0.3 MB of ROM space.
development_findings.quote: I removed the original MK64 backgrounds and it saved around 0.3 MB of ROM space.

development_findings.summary: Explored overworld water-level manipulation reminiscent of Wet-Dry World; may tie to the island-rescue narrative.
development_findings.quote: There's a good chance that would be in the overworld, because the overworld is an island that you rescue, so it makes sense if water returned over time.

development_findings.summary: Fixed OnlyUp64 physics bugs (ledge-grab, steep-wall rejection) and back-ported improvements to the main branch.
development_findings.quote: You can ledge grab… In Mario 64 on a wall like this you can't jump, but I fixed that.

development_findings.summary: Identified that the numKeys variable no longer updates; replaced it with a custom progress tracker for soap shrinkage.
Prototype for oil-slick mechanic: alpha-masked texture that Mario erases with soap; considering HSV-based rainbow reflections and ice-like slipperiness.
development_findings.quote: Oil slick: Mario goes through with soap, deletes the alpha on the pixels he's touched.

development_findings.summary: Confirmed Fast64 as the main level-export pipeline; relies on IA-16 textures and 1.8-ratio DX4 compression to stay within ROM limits.
Noted memory–performance trade-off of orange fog; may drop it to keep framerate.
development_findings.quote: The orange fog actually makes this run a lot worse, so we could just remove that.

context_findings.summary: Kaze received a rape threat online, an uncommon and upsetting experience for him.
context_findings.quote: This is the first time this happened to me. I as a male have gotten a rape threat.

context_findings.summary: Shows frustration with frequent Parallel Launcher updates.
context_findings.quote: If I open Parallel Launcher right now and there’s an update I’m gonna be pissed… There’s three! It’s been a week!

context_findings.summary: Playful philosophical digressions (microwave time, base-12 numbers) reveal Kaze’s humorous, systems-thinking mindset.
Mentions Zeina is at work and jokes he is "being held hostage," hinting at lighthearted personal dynamics.
Ends stream due to hunger, illustrating long working sessions and minimal breaks.

biobak.summary: Provided multiple concept iterations for the star-select panorama UI, influencing the chosen direction.
biobak.quote: Biobak had this here, which I think works a lot better already.

biobak.summary: Suggested having soap bubbles fade from pink to white; Kaze implemented the shader accordingly.

zeina.summary: Absent this session; Kaze notes she is at her job during the stream.
zeina.quote: Zeina is actually at work right now.

key_stories.title: Soap Bar Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze needed a fresh mobility gimmick and invented a rideable soap bar. Discovering Mario 64’s hidden Ridden-OBJ interaction let him prototype the mechanic in one stream.
key_stories.challenge: Create a new object that feels unique yet leverages existing physics.
key_stories.process: Re-used Koopa shell logic, fixed variables, built shrink and bubble-trail systems.
key_stories.outcome: Fully functional soap bar completed in <1 day; slated for use in beach level and oil-cleanup gameplay.
key_stories.key_quote: We programmed the whole soap bar just today—that’s not that bad.

key_stories.title: Panoramic Star-Select Memory Crunch
key_stories.summary: High-resolution images for each course would bloat the ROM, so the team pivoted to miniature real-time panoramas.
key_stories.challenge: Keep course-select visuals attractive without adding 0.5 MB per level.
key_stories.process: Biobak mocked up concepts; Kaze benchmarked ROM usage and decided on lightweight 3D scenes.
key_stories.outcome: New UI direction approved; implementation ongoing.
key_stories.key_quote: A 320×240 image would take around 0.5 MB. Pre-rendered 3D is cheaper and looks better.

key_stories.title: The Oil Slick Dilemma
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants Mario to clean oily puddles with the soap bar but is unsure how to achieve reflective, dynamic visuals within N64 limits.
key_stories.challenge: Dynamic, shiny surface on fixed-function hardware.
key_stories.process: Tested alpha-mask erasure, HSV vertex colours, and normal-map tricks; studied Mario Kart oil; postponed final art until he can observe real oil.
key_stories.outcome: Concept sketched; technical approach logged for next session.
key_stories.key_quote: I wish I had oil here I could spill on the floor and look at.
